author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In market's murky veil, the oil doth wane,
With whispers of a pact 'tween foes of yore.
As weekly loss emerges, crude winds flail,
For fresh supplies, the world may soon explore.

The drought in China's realm its snares extend,
And yonder, metals rise in London's morn.
With aluminium's price, an upward trend,
From nature's cruel grasp, is tightly worn.

Lo, Hafize Gaye, in Turkish halls of might,
To Central Bank's high seat, she now ascends,
A nod to more-orthodox ways in sight,
As First Republic's ghost her path attends.

feedItems.title: Oil Set for Weekly Loss as Reports of US, Iran Deal Progress Weighs on Crude
feedItems.description: Oil prices edged lower in Europe and are on course for a weekly loss as reports of progress in talks between Iran and the U.S. add the possibility of fresh supplies to the market.

feedItems.title: Aluminum Gains on Threat to Chinese Output
feedItems.description: Base metals prices rose in early London trading, and aluminium prices were higher as a drought in China threatened to undermine production.

feedItems.title: Turkey Names Former First Republic Executive as Head of Central Bank
feedItems.description: Hafize Gaye Erkan’s appointment represents a possible return to more-orthodox economic policies.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In the market's tumult and the morrow's wake,
The FTSE 100 falteth, cautious heart at stake,
As central banks convene, futures to make,
Croda's decline, a somber reminder take.

A feeble greenback withers, brought low by claims,
Yet steadies at the nadir, where desire tames,
UniCredit foretells of a calm untamed,
Awaiting the Fed and ECB's fickle flames.

In distant lands, of China's vast empire's might,
A window opened, casting truth and light,
On kickback's siren call, a cunning blight,
Pioneering paths where resources' deals ignite.

feedItems.title: FTSE 100 Edges Lower on Caution Before Fed, ECB Decisions Next Week; Croda Slides
feedItems.description: The FTSE 100 edged down in opening trade, with investors cautious in the run up to next week’s key central bank meetings.

feedItems.title: Dollar Stays Weak After High US Jobless Claims, Should Steady at Lower Levels
feedItems.description: The dollar remained weak following sharp falls on Thursday, but UniCredit Research said the currency could steady from here as traders stay cautious ahead of events next week, including decisions by the Fed and the ECB.

feedItems.title: Court Papers Open Rare Window Into Role of Graft in China's Overseas Lending
feedItems.description: A former state bank executive collected millions in kickbacks as he helped pioneer Beijing’s resource-for-infrastructure investment model in the Global South.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the chamber where secrets speak,
Stands young Holland, with mind so deep,
A thrilling tale, their triumph lies,
In the tapestry woven by Apple’s eyes.

Far in the East, where dragons wake,
No fiery breath doth inflation take,
Their golden hoard stays cool and still,
Whilst Western banks toil up the hill.

Heralds proclaim a pact anew,
AstraZeneca and Quell pursue,
A healing touch, their quest doth start,
For autoimmune ill, they seek an Art.

feedItems.title: 'The Crowded Room' Review: Viewers' Patience Rewarded
feedItems.description: Tom Holland and Amanda Seyfried shine as suspect and interrogator in an intricate 10-part thriller from Apple TV+.

feedItems.title: China's Inflation Problem? It Has None
feedItems.description: As Western central banks continue to jack up interest rates to douse stubbornly high inflation, China faces a growing risk of the opposite problem—deflation.

feedItems.title: AstraZeneca Enters Pact with Cell Therapy Startup
feedItems.description: AstraZeneca will pay Quell Therapeutics $85 million upfront for it to help develop treatments for autoimmune diseases, and further payments of more than $2 billion for future development and commercial milestones and royalties.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In bonds of Eurozone, a peak hath met,
Where interest raised, no more shall fret,
The long-term yields, as wise men bet,
By words of Capital Economics, set.

Summoned now to Miami's hold,
Trump of old, in case untold,
Of documents of secret lore,
He standeth tall at courthouse door.

A change of guard at Dassault's gate,
New leader Pascal taketh the plate,
With targets hushed and profits great,
€2.2 to €2.4 a share awaits.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Government Bond Yields Likely Have Peaked
feedItems.description: Further ECB interest-rate rises this year are unlikely to trigger another leg up in long-term eurozone government bond yields, Capital Economics said.

feedItems.title: Trump Indicted in Classified Documents Case
feedItems.description: The former president said he has been summoned to the federal courthouse in Miami over his handling of government documents at Mar-a-Lago.

feedItems.title: Dassault Systems Outlines Midterm Targets; Names New CEO
feedItems.description: Dassault Systemes forecast double-digit revenue growth and earnings of €2.2-€2.4 a share in 2028, as the software company named Pascal Daloz as its new CEO effective the beginning of next year.
